title: Let me tell you what is a hellish comp to play against.
body: 3 champions on the enemy team consist of swain, soraka, and WW.  Your allies bring 1 ignite to the table and don't bother to build any grevious wounds items even after suggesting it. >.> pls allies, pls.{{item:3070}}

replies.body: Sometimes I build {{item:3165}} on {{champion:21}}  to remember the feeling of having GW.
Sometimes I build {{item:3070}} whenever I remember having GW.
Went up against a lane with Soraka support yesterday as MF, kept saying to myself in my head, "Man... sure would be nice if I still had grievous wounds..."

It wasn't that useful. Or at least against competent players it wasn't since they would just disengage if they were losing and heal after Grevious Wounds past. Oh and Soraka could remove it with her ult anyways.
In extended trades it was useful or when they wished to go all in, also Raka's ult meant nothing to MF's GW because MF applied it with every auto so you'd just reaply it right after she ulted.
{{champion:53}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:64}} are probably the worst to play against. Can't get away and to make it worse, youre being pulled to your death.

{{champion:150}} "Hey, look! I flashed out of {{champion:122}}'s p- OH GOD NO"
**FIRST BLOOD**
{{champion:67}} "gg, report gnar feeding"
Honestly, the fact that this is changing is the best part of the Darius rework to me.

Yeah i agree wholeheartedly. 0_0 though darius on pbe is so much more scary than he is now.... just watch Pants are Dragon play him....

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z57JzBKxE4s
Only 4 hookers? Did you forget about the 5th?{{champion:103}}

Kite them. 
Until you get hit like four hooks at once, at which point your kite promptly bursts into flames.

{{champion:107}} {{champion:28}}  {{champion:103}}  {{champion:29}}  {{champion:412}} 

If you see Thresh "alone" its time to run.
at least they didnt have a {{champion:36}}

{{champion:61}} Mid
{{champion:429}}  ADC
{{champion:54}}  Support
{{champion:62}}  Top
{{champion:32}} Jungle

Props to Instalok for this idea. The ult wombo combo is ridiculous.

I prefer 
{{champion:154}} Jungle
{{champion:14}} Support/top
{{champion:429}} ADC
 {{champion:54}}  Support/top
{{champion:157}} Mid

The amount of knock up made the game hilarious, a correct chain of CC made it upwards of 6 seconds of knock ups. We never lost a team fight, or even a gank because of how coordinated it was. We might not have gotten the 5 man wombo combo, but when you essentially remove atleast 3 enemies with just ultimate's games end super quickly, mix in 3 zz'rot portals and you have an unstoppable push. Who cares about dragon or baron when the enemy cant use it anyways
Think I've seen this and it is gnarly.

{{champion:14}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:69}} .

You have no engage and their tanks know how to peel.

Good luck.

Recently ran {{champion:22}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:122}} .

I can't say I envied the other team.
Hey now, there is also this {{item:3151}} . oh wait....
You're assuming Tryndaqueer actually left top lane?
Maybe all the fights took place in top lane :P

Comps I hate the most are the cheesy ones with two or more stealth/clone champs.

Had to fight those a couple of times. Usually I win by mid-late game, but getting there is so painful and the battle so annoying that I just feel no joy in winning, only bitterness.

I enjoy creating Wombo-Combo teams such as something like this...
{{champion:54}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:15}}

played a game with these guys where everyone ran teleport smite, the combos were insane

Bonus points if the ADC was rocking a BT
sounds like a personal problem
